description: SAYLESS is a decentralized, anonymous crime reporting platform where users can submit encrypted reports via WhatsApp, SMS, or Web using session-based anonymity. The platform ensures privacy, deniability, and trust using blockchain-inspired UX. This task is FRONTEND ONLY â€” no backend, no blockchain integration, no encryption logic.

pages.name: LandingPage
pages.description: Hero landing page introducing SAYLESS with three role-based entry points.
components: Three large role cards: Reporter, Authority, Jury
Animated warning banner: 'Even we cannot read reports'

pages.name: ReporterHome
pages.description: Dashboard for anonymous reporters using session-based identity.
components: Session ID badge (random string, frontend only)
Buttons: Create Report, Silent Report, My Reputation, Rewards
Status cards showing report count, stake used, reputation score

pages.name: CreateReport
components: Optional text area (with warning: 'This will be encrypted')
Submit button that simulates encryption + IPFS commit

pages.name: SilentReport
components: Instruction panel explaining missed-call or tap-based reporting

pages.name: AuthorityDashboard
pages.description: Dashboard for authorized authorities reviewing reports.
components: Status tags: New / Under Review / Accepted / Rejected

pages.name: JuryDashboard
pages.description: DAO-style jury interface for dispute resolution.

constraints: All data mocked using local state
goal: Create a visually striking, judge-ready MVP UI that demonstrates an impossible-feeling system where reports can exist without revealing identity, content, or even the act of reporting.
